meanings.definition: Stern or harsh in appearance or manner
meanings.sent1: The dour teacher rarely smiled in class.
meanings.sent2: His dour expression made it hard to approach him.
meanings.sent3: Despite his dour demeanor, he secretly loved silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: The dour clouds seemed to scowl down at the town below.
meanings.sent5: The dour face of the statue left a lasting impression on visitors.

meanings.sent1: Her dour mood cast a shadow over the party.

meanings.sent3: Even on a dour day, she found joy in small things.
meanings.sent4: The dour atmosphere in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The dour look on his face hinted at inner turmoil.

meanings.sent1: The dour painting evoked a sense of foreboding.

meanings.sent3: The dour fashion trend seemed out of place at the lively event.
